climbs.name: Wire and Fire
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, Mark Hathaway and TB, March 2011

content.description: Thin and sharp holds and tenuous as well.  Not the most fun to climb but challenging.
content.location: Starts two routes right of Beautiful Noise.

content.description: Vicious crimps on steep orange rock leads to thoughtful moves on gray runnels.
Shares the anchor with K9 Karma
fun route. if you stay left after the second bolt it makes it much easier try staying out of the crack left of the bolt line.
Stick clip first bolt.  Pull bouldery and continuous moves to brown brick feature at 3rd bolt.  Cruise upper half on excellent stone.
content.location: 30ft.right of Head Cleaner (2 routes over)at bottom of left facing arete.

content.description: will update ASAP
first route on slate

climbs.name: Sleet Happens
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, Brent Bingham and TB February 2013

content.description: Ascends two small roofs. Fun and powerful start to easier grey rock.
content.protection: Bolts to biners at the anchor
content.location: Two right of “the right stuff”

content.description:
Do a series of technical boulder moves to reach the small roof. Easier climbing reaches the anchors. It is very difficult to find a clipping stance for bolt #3, so have a very attentive belayer!

 Named for the fictitious annual event held in Winkelman wherein all the townspeople get together to celebrate the mining lifestyle. The highlight of this celebration is the “Night of Slagging” where all the folks just insult, slander, and otherwise abuse each other for sheer entertainment.
content.location: This is the last route before the ledge system as the base rises up and becomes more defined. Start below a prominent hole about 10 feet up.

content.description: Route harder or easier, depending on whether you push to stay left, or work mainly to the right, but doable either way. Work small holds and good friction up face past three bolts to Fixe Supershut clips at the top.
content.protection: 3 bolts, lower-off anchor at the top.
content.location: Farthest route to the right on Slate about 60 feet left of the gully between it and Finland. Three bolts to Fixe clips on a small, triangular shield of rock.

content.description: will update ASAP. Gambler route. RIP.

climbs.name: The Right Stuff
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, David Burke and TB, March 2011

content.description: Interesting and committing off the ground.  Stays on you to the roof where it jumps all over you.  Sequence is everything.  Dark grey rock over roof is only slightly unpleasant to pull on.
content.location: Third route right of Beautiful Noise.  Starts with right angling laybacks.

content.description: Nice climb once the wall is in the shade.
content.location: To the left of Atmospheric Slate (5.8).

content.description: Redneck Riviera begins with a thin technical boulder sequence on a gently overhanging wall. The difficulty of the climbing eases throughout the route but the climbing stays good until the end. Overall, a good route with powerful an engaging movement on high quality rock.
content.protection: 6 Bolts to rap rings; chains and biners were added to the anchor on 12.5.21.  Stick clip recommended for first bolt.

content.description: will update ASAP
same start as Evolver but finishes to the right. 6 bolts to chains
This climb holds nothing back with tricky moves and painful crimps off the deck.  Fear not, however, because the climb is done after the second bolt.
content.protection: 5 bolts to ring anchors.  A stick clip is handy for safely pulling the crux.
content.location: Second route from the left in Slate Nation.  To the left is some distance followed by 'Smooth as Slate' (5.8).  To the right is a series of challenging climbs; the first of which is 'Redneck Riviera (5.13a).

content.description: Pull a few engaging moves off the ground on sharp gray limestone to lower angle meandering on more sharp gray limestone.  Just when you think the anchors should appear you get to continue up past ledges on sharp loose gray limestone.  Beware there is a range of loose stuff from pebbles to blocks on the upper section.
content.location: Far right side of Slate Nation.  To the left is a fixed line for getting past a thin section of the ledge.  To the right is Razor Stubbly.

content.description:
Although quite short, it makes up for its lack of height in sustained, bouldery cruxes. Strenuous, technical climbing passes 4 bolts, finally relenting for the fifth and last bolt.

 The name comes from the sign of the Mini Market in Winkelman.
content.location: This climb begins where the base ledge widens out. Left of 'Sleet Happens'

content.description: Powerful side pulls, pinches, and crimps through the second bolt lead to technical face climbing. A roof move takes you to the top.
content.location: between finger monkey and Bombay sapphire

content.description: Fun climb that moves up and left.
content.location: Located to the right of Slate Nation Blues.

content.description: Pull into right facing dihedral follow liebacks and stemming moves to a big reach out and left of the roof to a headwall finish. Bolted by Larry.
content.location: A little more than half way up Slate Nation.

content.description: will update ASAP. Gambler route. RIP.

climbs.name: Groovy Infection
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, TB and DC January 2011

content.description: A steep section of good holds leads to smaller, but very positive edges that reach a shallow left-facing corner. Move up and out right, to where the angle finally relents, with some giant finishing buckets. Courtesey of Scott Ayers.
content.location: This route is located right of Strive Dreams, and approximately 15 left of Infectious Groove. Look for a line of bolts that begin above the thinnest section of the traverse ledge in that area. It is recommended that the belayer set up on the rocky ledge below to get a good stance.Courtesey of Scott Ayers.

content.description: Pull some bouldery cool moves to get established and up to the first bolt (crux).  From here bring your edging and slabbing skills.  Some nicely placed jugs break up the thin moves from time to time, although sections are harder than they look.
content.protection: 6 Bolts to Anchors, Stick Clip optional
content.location: Between "Bombay Sapphire" 11a and "Achy Brachiator" 11c.

content.description: Kind of a nice route with pretty big and positive holds up the featured shallow book to the left of Short and Sweet past four bolts to Fixe Supershut clips at the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts, lower-off anchor at the top.
content.location: Route is the second one in on the far right side of Slate, about 15 feet to the left of Short and Sweet in a broken, shallow corner.

content.description: A difficult boulder problem on rather sharp, small holds and side pulls leads to thoughtful climbing on runnels in grey stone.

Side pull on the block to reach the jug. Here, one can either go to an undercling, or make desperate pinches to move up to a sidepull near the third bolt. The face then eases to technical climbing followed by beautiful fossil filled jug hauling.
content.location: between face of spades and lost nation

content.description: Another route where the difficulty sort of depends on where you start and whether you try to stick to the left or the right. Either way, climb face on small holds and spiny friction past five bolts to FIxe Supershut clips at the top.
content.protection: 5 bolts, lower-off anchor at the top.
content.location: Route is the third one in from the far right on Slate, and 8 feet to the left of Golden Years.

content.description: hard to read but fun.
content.location: between steppin razor on finger monkey

climbs.name: The Destroyer
climbs.fa: Ethan Grayum and Gabe Grayum, Jan 2021

content.description: Stick clip the high first bolt.Start on a big left-hand sidepull and quickly enter a beta-intensive crux featuring small holds and smaller feet immediately followed by another crux. Easier climbing follows with one last tricky section. A slight runout on good holds leads to anchors below the barrel cactus.
content.protection: 4 bolts to ring anchors; chains and biners were added 12.5.21
content.location: Glue-in bolts left of Redneck Riviera.

content.description: just right of redneck riviera

climbs.name: Dancing With The Scars
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, David Burke and TB, March 2011

content.description: Weird first bolt placement a little left and low.  I broke a hold as I reached for the 2nd bolt clipping jug.  Fortunately the Steve was paying attention so I just touched the ground.  Fun after that.
content.location: Starts just right of Beautiful Noise at the end of the roped traverse.

content.description: Starts on a large enticing flake.  Climb up flake to a thin crimpy section.  Pull through the thinness to be rewarded by thirty feet of larger holds and awesome moves.
content.location: Left side of Slate Nation between Players Club (5.12c) and Reflections of Taunt (5.10a).

content.description: The first 15 feet are devious and forearm taxing.
content.location: This route is easy to find as it starts from a chunk of rock sticking out of the ground.  It is about 100 feet right of where the trail meets the cliff.  A number of large boulders are on the slope below the trail just past the spike you start from.  The first bolt is higher than usual for this area that often requires a stick clip.

content.description: This is a sustained and interesting route.  The holds are easy on sore fingertips even at the end of the day.
content.location: As you work your way along Slate nation toward Finland you come to a narrow ledge and a fixed line.  The route starts in the middle of the fixed line.  The belayer usually clips into the line so they can lean back and watch.

content.description: fun moderate
project for many years. nice job Pat
Powerful moves at the start w side pulls and undercling lead to a big pocket and easier grey rock
content.protection: Bolts to biners at the top
content.location: Just right of “Sleet Happens”

content.description: Low angle face typical of this section of stone leads to puzzling and hard moves up to the roof and a bolt I found hard to clip.  The move past the roof is hard to figure out as there isn't a way to see over it.  Tough onsight.
content.location: To the right of Head Cleaner and turns the roof where a short little arete leads up to it.

content.description: Start up on easy ground with holds for the first few bolts.  Slowly the holds die out just as you arrive at a small roof.  Pull over on some sidepulls and body position and hit the real crux, getting to the anchors.  Once you get level with the anchors there is a nice hold to clip from.
content.location: Starts just right of a belay bolt, with a loop of rope fixed to it.  In between the routes Hipster Dufus and Beautiful Noise.

content.description: This wall gets morning sunshine and afternoon shade so it can be climbed from fall to spring, later if you are a hard core desert rat.  It is the color of slate and has some bullet hard limestone.  The routes will be slightly less than vertical unless they are undercut at the bottom.  These can be pretty bouldery to start.  Routes range from 50 feet long to 25 feet at the right most end.  These right hand routes are new since spring 2006.
